H0.text: Temperature is what Fahrenheit, Celsius, and Kelvin measure.

H1.text: Brightness is the quantity measured by Fahrenheit, Celsius, and Kelvin units.

H2.text: Radiation is what Fahrenheit, Celsius, and Kelvin are units that measure.

H3.text: Precipitation is measured by Fahrenheit, Celsius, and Kelvin units.

A4.text: Modern temperature measurement relies on detecting physical properties that vary predictably with thermal energy, such as electrical resistance, thermoelectric voltage, or infrared radiation.

A5.text: Temperature is measured with thermometers that may be calibrated to a variety of temperature scales.
